pyglassdoor

A simple API for glassdoor.com

All methods require at least the company_id, which is the unique identifier for each company on glassdoor.com. The most straight-forward way to find this number is the company url on glassdoor.com.

For example, the company_id for Apple is 1138 which we can find in the urls of the company on glassdoor.com. Here are the overview, reviews, salaries , and interviews pages for apple:

  • https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Apple-EI_IE1138.11,16.htm

  • https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Apple-Reviews-E1138.htm

  • https://www.glassdoor.com/Salary/Apple-Salaries-E1138.htm

  • https://www.glassdoor.com/Salary/Apple-Salaries-E1138.htm

pyglassdoor.get_interviews(company_id: int, records_to_collect: int = 10, job_title: Optional[str] = None, location: Optional[dict] = None, job_function: Optional[int] = None, sort: str = 'RELEVANCE', session_info: Optional[dict] = None) → dict[source]

Returns the reviews of a company

Parameters

  • company_id (int) – The Glassdoor company ID

  • records_to_collect (int) – The maximum number of interviews to collect, defaults to 10

  • job_title (str, optional) – search phrase for the desired job title

  • location (dict, optional) – value for the location of the company/office

  • job_function (int, optional) – the identifier for desired job category, refer to the docs for more info

  • sort (str) –

    defaults to RELEVANCE

    DATE most recent first,

    DATE_ASC the oldest first,

    DIFFICULTY most difficult first,

    DIFFICULTY_ASC the easiest first,

    RELEVANCE for most relevant first,

    Note

    sort value should be all caps.

  • session_info (dict, optional) – dictionary that contains active session information

Returns

interviews of the specified company

Return type

dict, json

pyglassdoor.get_reviews(company_id: int, records_to_collect: int = 10, only_current_employees: bool = False, job_title: Optional[str] = None, location: Optional[dict] = None, employment_statuses: Optional[list] = None, job_function: Optional[int] = None, sort: str = 'RELEVANCE', language: str = 'eng', session_info: Optional[dict] = None) → dict[source]

Returns company reviews

Parameters

  • company_id (int) – The Glassdoor company ID

  • records_to_collect (int) – The maximum number of reviews to collect, defaults to 10

  • only_current_employees (bool) – boolean for whether to get only the reviews of current employees, defaults to False

  • job_title (str, optional) – search phrase for the desired job title

  • location (dict, optional) – value for the location of the company/office

  • employment_statuses (list, optional) –

    list of desired employment statues.

    PART_TIME for part-time employee reviews,

    CONTRACT for contractor reviews,

    INTERN for intern reviews,

    REGULAR for full-time employee reviews,

    FREELANCE for freelancers reviews,

    defaults to ["REGULAR", "PART_TIME"]

  • job_function (int, optional) – the identifier for desired job category, refer to the docs for more info

  • sort (str) –

    defaults to “RELEVANCE”

    DATE for most recent,

    RATING for highest ratings first,

    RATING_ASC for lowest ratings first,

    RELEVANCE for most relevant first,

    Note

    sort value should be all caps.

  • language (str) – ISO three-letter code of the language, defaults to eng

  • session_info (dict, optional) – dictionary that contains active session information

Returns

reviews of the specified company

Return type

dict, json

pyglassdoor.get_salaries(company_id: int, page_number: int = 1, job_title: Optional[str] = None, location: Optional[dict] = None, job_function: Optional[int] = None, sort: str = 'COUNT', display_as: str = 'ANNUAL', session_info: Optional[dict] = None) → dict[source]

Returns the salaries of a company

Parameters

  • company_id (int) – The Glassdoor company ID

  • page_number (int) – The page number of salary records to be collect, defaults to 1

  • job_title (str, optional) – search phrase for the desired job title

  • location (dict, optional) – value for the location of the company/office

  • job_function (int, optional) – the identifier for desired job category, refer to the docs for more info

  • sort (str) –

    defaults to COUNT

    can take any of the following values:

    COUNT most salaries submitted first,

    SALARY highest to the lowest salaries,

    SALARY_ASC lowest to the highest salaries,

  • display_as (str) –

    the level of aggregation, defaults to ANNUAL

    can take any of the following values:

    ANNUAL for annual pay periods,

    MONTHLY for monthly pay periods,

    HOURLY for hourly pay periods,

    None for assorted pay periods,

  • session_info (dict, optional) – dictionary that contains active session information

Returns

the salaries of a company

Return type

dict, json

pyglassdoor.get_session_info() → dict[source]

Generate header information for request session.

This step is integrated in data queries and can be skipped. But if the user decides to reuse header information for multiple queries (e.g., to save time), then this query is to be used.

Returns

session information required for an authorized query

Return type

dict
